title: How does the concept '1' map to physical reality? - Quora

response.answer_text: It does not. number terms are names for imaginary, ideal, immutable concepts which we represent with symbols like “1” and “2”, etc. these imaginary concepts do not “map” to anything in this imperfect world since everything in this world is in a constant state of mutation. numbers are useful fictions since we have the need to count and measure. But we must be aware that when we count, we count unlikes, in violation of all mathematical regulations. And when we measure, we do so within a margin of error that can never be eliminated. so the number “1” does not map to anything in reality.

through the consciousness, which accepts what’s given to it by perception — itself accepting that sensation has been felt, though not knowing what’s causing it. then, in an event where negation is allowed, a ‘one’ is created. so, no ‘one’ without ‘none’ — not, ‘without two’, since ‘two is just one plus one’. note, that there is no ‘zero’, just ‘designated or non-designated.’
